pageContext.description: Three vertical ribs on each face; at each side of these, however, at the edges of the axe, is a suggestion of another rib, making five ribs in all. A three-lobed hole in the side across two ribs in the face drawn.
pageContext.associations: A. 3121 (1-3); A.3121 (5-7) formerly numbered A.3121 (6-8), respectively. An 8th Axe in Cheltenham Museum,
pageContext.publications: Ant. Journ. XII, 283, f., XV, 196, XXI, 150.,Trans. B.G.A.S., XXX, 26.
pageContext.collection: Gloucester City Museum, A.3121 (4),Given in 1958 by the late Mrs. E. K. Coulter of Wimbledon, per Lt. Col. W. E. K. Coles,Finder: Mr. Bowles
pageContext.site: England,Gloucestershire,Bourton on the Water,Found one mile north of Bourton on the Water, 400 feet south of Slaughter Bridge and east of Fosse Way during ploughing in 1907 in a field called Meeting House Ground; covered by what appears to have been a behive-shaped stone cist.
pageContext.toSearch: Slaughter Bridge, Bourton-on-the-water, Cheltenham, Gloucestershire Gl54, UK
